question.text: Which of the following statements is not true for class Phaeophyceae?

options.text: Vegetative reproduction takes place by fragmentation.
The protoplast contains, in addition to plastids, a centrally located vacuole and nucleus.
Sexual reproduction may be isogamous, anisogamous or oogamous.

solution.text: Members of class phaeophyceae are commonly called Brown algae. In most brown algae asexual reproduction takes place by biflagellate zoospores that are pear-shaped and have two unequal laterally attached flagella. In these algae vegetative reproduction takes place gfragmentation while sexual reproduction takes place by isogamy or anisogamy or oogamy.
